task: Create a 4-on-the-floor kick drum pattern in FL Studio
lesson: The first click at x=411 landed in the selector/label zone rather than on an actual step button. In FL Studio's step sequencer, the clickable step buttons start further to the right — need to identify the exact left boundary of step 1 before clicking.

task: Create a 4-on-the-floor kick drum pattern in FL Studio
lesson: The 4-on-the-floor pattern requires clicks on steps 1, 5, 9, 13 (evenly spaced every 4 steps). The clicks at x=433, 501, 569 are not evenly spaced (gaps of 68 and 68 pixels between last two but the first gap from 411 to 433 is only 22px), indicating the agent lost track of which

task: Create a 4-on-the-floor kick drum pattern in FL Studio
lesson: Five zoom actions were used but still resulted in misclicks. Instead of repeatedly zooming the same narrow region, take one zoom, carefully map out all 16 step button x-coordinates, calculate the pixel spacing, then click all four targets in sequence without additional zooms.

task: Create a 4-on-the-floor kick drum pattern in FL Studio
lesson: After the first misclick landed in the selector zone (step 5), the agent undid it (step 7) but then immediately clicked again at a nearby coordinate without verifying the step grid boundaries. A better approach: after an undo, zoom to confirm the exact positions of step buttons 1
